hypothesis: Charles Marie de La Condamine was born in the 1700's.
premise: + Charles Marie de La Condamine + Charles Marie de La Condamine ( 28 January 1701 - 13 February 1774 ) was a French explorer , geographer , and mathematician .
explanation_1: Charles Marie de La Condamine was born in the 1700's.

hypothesis: Chris Pratt starred in Jurassic World.
premise: + Chris Pratt + In 2015 , he starred in Jurassic World , the fourth installment in the Jurassic Park franchise and his most financially successful film to date , earning $ 1.6 billion at the box office . + Jurassic World + Jurassic World is a 2015 American science-fiction adventure film and the fourth installment of the Jurassic Park series . + Jurassic World + The film was directed and co-written by Colin Trevorrow , produced by Frank Marshall and Patrick Crowley , and stars Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard . + Chris Pratt + Christopher Michael Pratt ( born June 21 , 1979 ) is an American actor .
explanation_1: Chris Pratt starred in Jurassic World, which was directed and co-written by Colin Trevorrow, produced by Frank Marshall and Patrick Crowley, and stars Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard.

hypothesis: Machu Picchu is a citadel.
premise: + Machu Picchu + Machu Picchu  ( Machu Pikchu  ) is a 15th-century Inca citadel situated on a mountain ridge 2430 m above sea level .
explanation_1: Machu Picchu is a citadel, however it is not the only one.

hypothesis: Machu Picchu was located in the Americas.
premise: + Machu Picchu + Machu Picchu  ( Machu Pikchu  ) is a 15th-century Inca citadel situated on a mountain ridge 2430 m above sea level . + Machu Picchu + It is located in the Cusco Region , Urubamba Province , Machupicchu District in Peru , above the Sacred Valley , which is 80 km northwest of Cuzco and through which the Urubamba River flows . + Peru + Peru , is a country in western South America . + Inca Empire + The Inca Empire ( Quechua : Tawantinsuyu , `` The Four Regions '' ) , also known as the Incan Empire and the Inka Empire , was the largest empire in pre-Columbian America , and possibly the largest empire in the world in the early 16th century . + Sacred Valley + The Sacred Valley of the Incas ( Valle Sagrado de los Incas Willka Qhichwa ) or the Urubamba Valley is a valley in the Andes of Peru , 20 km at its closest north of the Inca capital of Cusco .
explanation_1: Machu Picchu is located in Peru, which is in the Americas.

hypothesis: Jeff Perry was born in August.
premise: + Jeff Perry (American actor) + Jeffrey Perry ( born August 16 , 1955 ) is an American actor of stage , television , and film .
explanation_1: Jeff Perry was born in 1955, however it does not say whether he was born in August.

hypothesis: Diego Costa is an athlete.
premise: + Diego Costa + Diego da Silva Costa (  ,  born 7 October 1988 ) , is a professional footballer who plays as a striker for English club Chelsea and the Spain national team . + Association football + Association football , more commonly known as football or soccer , is a team sport played between two teams of eleven players with a spherical ball . + 2014 FIFA World Cup + The 2014 FIFA World Cup was the 20th FIFA World Cup , the quadrennial world championship for men 's national football teams organized by FIFA . + Spain national football team + The Spain national football team ( Selección de fútbol de España ) represents Spain in men 's International association football and is controlled by the Royal Spanish Football Federation , the governing body for football in Spain . + Chelsea F.C. + Chelsea Football Club  is an English professional football club based in Fulham , London , that competes in the Premier League , of which they are reigning champions .
explanation_1: Diego Costa is a professional footballer who plays as a striker for Chelsea and the Spain national team. He is not an athlete.

hypothesis: Arrow's first four seasons are available on DVD and Blu-ray, as well as a soundtrack for the first two seasons.
premise: + Arrow (TV series) + The first four seasons are available on DVD and Blu-ray in regions 1 , 2 and 4 ; a soundtrack was also released for the first two seasons .
explanation_1: Arrow's first four seasons are available on DVD and Blu-ray, as well as a soundtrack for the first two seasons.

hypothesis: Calvin Harris has a greater number of songs on the UK Singles Chart than Michael Jackson.
premise: + Calvin Harris + Harris currently holds the record for the most top 10 songs from one studio album on the UK Singles Chart with nine top 10 entries , surpassing Michael Jackson . + UK Singles Chart + The UK Singles Chart ( currently entitled Official Singles Chart ) is compiled by the Official Charts Company ( OCC ) , on behalf of the British record industry , listing the top-selling singles in the United Kingdom , based upon physical sales , paid-for downloads and streaming .
explanation_1: Calvin Harris has nine songs on the UK Singles Chart, whereas Michael Jackson has only five songs on the UK Singles Chart.

hypothesis: Warren Buffett works for a business magnate.
premise: + Warren Buffett + Warren Edward Buffett (  born August 30 , 1930 ) is an American business magnate , investor , and philanthropist .
explanation_1: Warren Buffett is a business magnate.

hypothesis: Robert Wagner avoided writing professionally.
premise: + Robert Wagner + Wagner 's autobiography , Pieces of My Heart : A Life , written with author Scott Eyman , was published on September 23 , 2008 . + The Pink Panther (1963 film) + The Pink Panther is a 1963 American comedy film directed by Blake Edwards and co-written by Edwards and Maurice Richlin , starring David Niven , Peter Sellers , Robert Wagner , Capucine , and Claudia Cardinale . + Robert Wagner + In movies , Wagner is known for his role as Number Two in the Austin Powers trilogy of films ( 1997 , 1999 , 2002 ) , as well as for A Kiss Before Dying , The Pink Panther , Harper , The Towering Inferno and many more . + A Kiss Before Dying (1956 film) + The screenplay was written by Lawrence Roman , based on Ira Levin 's 1953 novel of the same name , which won the 1954 Edgar Award for `` Best First Novel . ''
explanation_1: Robert Wagner has written an autobiography, Pieces of My Heart: A Life, which was published on September 23, 2008.

hypothesis: Celine Dion signed with one of Marvel's acting studios.
premise: + Epic Records + Epic Records is an American record label owned by Sony Music Entertainment , a subsidiary of Sony Corporation of America , Inc. . + Celine Dion + Following a series of French albums during the 1980s , she signed on to Epic Records in the United States .
explanation_1: Celine Dion signed with Epic Records, not with one of Marvel's acting studios.

hypothesis: Julius Caesar was released in the 1950s.
premise: + Julius Caesar (1953 film) + Julius Caesar is a 1953 epic Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer film adaptation of the play by Shakespeare , directed by Joseph L. Mankiewicz , who also wrote the uncredited screenplay , and produced by John Houseman . + Julius Caesar (1970 film) + Julius Caesar is a 1970 British independent film adaptation of William Shakespeare 's play of the same name , directed by Stuart Burge from a screenplay by Robert Furnival .
explanation_1: Julius Caesar was released in 1953 and 1970.

hypothesis: One Direction are personalities.
premise: + One Direction + One Direction ( commonly abbreviated as 1D ) are an English-Irish pop boy band based in London , composed of Niall Horan , Liam Payne , Harry Styles , Louis Tomlinson , and previously , Zayn Malik until his departure from the band on 25 March 2015 . + One Direction + In 2016 Forbes ranked them the world 's second highest earning celebrities . + One Direction + In 2014 , Forbes listed them the second-highest earning celebrities under 30 , with the group earning an estimated $ 75 million from June 2013 to June 2014 . + One Direction + In June 2015 , Forbes listed their earnings at $ 130 million for the previous twelve months , and ranked them the fourth highest earning celebrities in the world . + Syco Music + Syco Music , also known as Syco Records , is a British record label founded by British music mogul Simon Cowell .
explanation_1: One Direction are a boy band.

hypothesis: Rachel McAdams worked on a project directed by George Lucas.
premise: + Rachel McAdams + She returned to prominence in 2009 by appearing in the political-thriller State of Play , the science-fiction romantic drama The Time Traveler 's Wife and the mystery action-adventure film Sherlock Holmes . + Rachel McAdams + After graduating from a four-year theatre program at York University in 2001 , she initially worked in Canadian television and film productions such as the drama film Perfect Pie ( 2002 ) ( for which she received a Genie Award nomination ) , the comedy film My Name Is Tanino ( 2002 ) , and the comedy series Slings and Arrows ( for which she won a Gemini Award ) . + Rachel McAdams + McAdams rose to fame in 2004 with her roles in the comedy Mean Girls and the romantic drama The Notebook . + Rachel McAdams + In 2005 , she starred in the romantic comedy Wedding Crashers , the psychological thriller Red Eye , and the family comedy-drama The Family Stone . + Spotlight (film) + Spotlight is a 2015 American biographical crime drama film directed by Tom McCarthy and written by McCarthy and Josh Singer .
explanation_1: Rachel McAdams has worked on a project directed by George Lucas, however it does not say whether it was Star Wars.

hypothesis: Saamy was remade in America.
premise: + Saamy + It was remade in Telugu as Lakshmi Narasimha ( 2004 ) starring Nandamuri Balakrishna and Asin , in Bengali as Barood starring Mithun Chakraborty , in Kannada as Ayya ( 2005 ) starring Darshan and Rakshitha and later in Hindi as Policegiri ( 2013 ) starring Sanjay Dutt and Prachi Desai . + Barood (2004 film) + The film was a remake of Tamil film Saamy . + Lakshmi Narasimha + Lakshmi Narasimha is a 2004 Telugu action film produced by Bellamkonda Suresh on Sri Sai Ganesh Productions banner , directed by Jayanth C. Paranjee .
explanation_1: Saamy was remade in Telugu, Bengali, Kannada and Hindi. It was not remade in America.

hypothesis: Conan O'Brien was rejected for a television host position.
premise: + Conan O'Brien + Conan Christopher O'Brien ( born April 18 , 1963 ) is an American television host , comedian , and television producer . + Conan (talk show) + Conan is a late-night talk show airing each Monday through Thursday at 11:00 p.m. eastern time on TBS in the United States . + Late Night with Conan O'Brien + Late Night with Conan O'Brien is an American late-night talk show hosted by Conan O'Brien that aired 2,725 episodes on NBC between 1993 and 2009 . + The Simpsons + The Simpsons is an American animated sitcom created by Matt Groening for the Fox Broadcasting Company . + Conan O'Brien + O'Brien was a writer and producer for The Simpsons for two seasons until he was commissioned by NBC to take over David Letterman 's position as host of Late Night in 1993 .
explanation_1: Conan O'Brien was rejected for a television host position, however he was later commissioned by NBC to take over David Letterman's position as host of Late Night in 1993.

hypothesis: Brave is a 2012 television series.
premise: + Brave (2012 film) + Brave is a 2012 American 3D computer-animated fantasy comedy-drama film produced by Pixar Animation Studios and released by Walt Disney Pictures . + Kelly Macdonald + Kelly Macdonald ( born 23 February 1976 ) is a Scottish actress , known for her roles in the films Trainspotting ( 1996 ) , Gosford Park ( 2001 ) , Intermission ( 2003 ) , Nanny McPhee ( 2005 ) , Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows - Part 2 ( 2011 ) and Brave ( 2012 ) . + Brave (2012 film) + Brave premiered on June 10 , 2012 , at the Seattle International Film Festival , and was released in North America on June 22 , 2012 , to both positive reviews and box office success . + 3D film + A three-dimensional stereoscopic film ( also known as three-dimensional film , 3D film or S3D film ) is a motion picture that enhances the illusion of depth perception , hence adding a third dimension . + Seattle International Film Festival + The Seattle International Film Festival ( SIFF ) , held annually in Seattle , Washington since 1976 , is among the top film festivals in North America .
explanation_1: Brave is a 2012 film, not a television series.

hypothesis: Imagine Dragons is from Denmark.
premise: + Imagine Dragons + Imagine Dragons is an American rock band from Las Vegas , Nevada , consisting of lead vocalist Dan Reynolds , lead guitarist Wayne Sermon , bassist Ben McKee , and drummer Daniel Platzman . + Nevada + Nevada ( Spanish for `` snowy '' ; see pronunciations ) is a state in the Western , Mountain West , and Southwestern regions of the United States of America .
explanation_1: Imagine Dragons is from Las Vegas, Nevada.

hypothesis: Ayn Rand supported collectivism.
premise: + Ayn Rand + In politics , she condemned the initiation of force as immoral , and opposed collectivism and statism as well as anarchism , and instead supported laissez-faire capitalism , which she defined as the system based on recognizing individual rights . + Conservatism in the United States + American Conservatism is a broad system of political beliefs in the United States that is characterized by respect for American traditions , support for Judeo-Christian values , economic liberalism , anti-communism , advocacy of American exceptionalism , and a defense of Western culture from threats posed by `` creeping socialism '' , moral relativism , multiculturalism and liberal internationalism . + Ayn Rand + She is known for her two best-selling novels , The Fountainhead and Atlas Shrugged , and for developing a philosophical system she called Objectivism . + Ayn Rand + She has been a significant influence among libertarians and American conservatives . + Ayn Rand + She supported rational and ethical egoism , and rejected altruism .
explanation_1: Ayn Rand was a supporter of laissez-faire capitalism, which she defined as the system based on recognizing individual rights. She was not a supporter of collectivism.

hypothesis: The United States Environmental Protection Agency has a staff that mainly consists of programmers, biologists, and teachers.
premise: + United States Environmental Protection Agency + More than half of EPA 's employees are engineers , scientists , and environmental protection specialists ; other employees include legal , public affairs , financial , and information technologists .
explanation_1: The United States Environmental Protection Agency has a staff that mainly consists of engineers, scientists, and environmental protection specialists.

explanation_1: Estella Warren was born December 23, 1978.

hypothesis: Coldplay released The Blue Room in 1995.
premise: + Coldplay + The band renamed themselves `` Coldplay '' in 1998 , before recording and releasing three EPs : Safety in 1998 and Brothers & Sisters and The Blue Room in 1999 . + The Blue Room (EP) + The Blue Room is the second EP released by British rock band Coldplay , and their first release after signing with the Parlophone label in October 1999 . + Coldplay + The Blue Room was their first release on a major label , after signing to Parlophone .
explanation_1: Coldplay released The Blue Room in 1999, not in 1995.

hypothesis: The Panic in Needle Park was unable to cast Kitty Winn.
premise: + The Panic in Needle Park + The film is a love story between Bobby ( Pacino ) , a young addict and small-time hustler , and Helen ( Kitty Winn ) , a restless woman whom finds Bobby charismatic . + Kitty Winn + She is best known for her roles as the heroin addict Helen in the romantic drama The Panic in Needle Park and her recurring role of Sharon Spencer in the horror film franchise The Exorcist . + Kitty Winn + Katherine Tupper `` Kitty '' Winn ( born February 21 , 1943 ) is an American theatre and film actress . + The Panic in Needle Park + The Panic in Needle Park is a 1971 American romantic drama film directed by Jerry Schatzberg and starring Al Pacino , in his second film appearance .
explanation_1: The Panic in Needle Park was able to cast Kitty Winn.

hypothesis: Katy Perry is not a singer.
premise: + Katy Perry + Katheryn Elizabeth Hudson ( born October 25 , 1984 ) , known professionally as Katy Perry , is an American singer and songwriter . + Prism (Katy Perry album) + Prism is the fourth studio album by American singer Katy Perry . + Roar (song) + `` Roar '' is a song by American singer Katy Perry for her fourth studio album , Prism ( 2013 ) . + Part of Me (Katy Perry song) + `` Part of Me '' is a song by American singer Katy Perry , released as the lead single from Teenage Dream : The Complete Confection . + Dark Horse (Katy Perry song) + `` Dark Horse '' is a song recorded by American singer Katy Perry featuring rapper Juicy J .
explanation_1: Katy Perry is a singer.
